quote: Knowledge now melts faster than organizations can re-bind it into identity, norms, and operating systems—without depleting trust.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Under that pressure, the primary obstacle to progress is no longer technical—it’s cultural.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The method is a loop you can actually run: critique → dissolution → reconstitution → renewal.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Call the speed at which a person, team, organization, or city digests error into new structure its epimetabolic rate.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Dionysus governs Ritual Time—containers in which critique is welcomed, meanings are allowed to melt, and new commitments are forged in public.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Apollo governs what I’ll call Run Time—prediction, execution, scored forecasts, safety margins.
author: Sean Devine

quote: **The Readiness Rule:** Never build a ritual container (Li) larger than the shared humanity (Ren) you have available to fill it.
author: Sean Devine

quote: In principle, any artifact, policy, or assumption can be nominated as an anti-scapegoat and put on trial.
author: Sean Devine

quote: We ritualize non-defensiveness: the builder speaks last; the critic holds the floor; the process owns the pain.
author: Sean Devine

quote: **Skin-in-the-Game Rule:** Every rite must be owned by the person or group with the most downside in its scope.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The *Dionysus Program* needs Cincinnatus because its rites create exactly the kind of liminal authority that tends to harden into priesthood.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The Jester’s Privilege keeps criticism of the stewards and the program metabolizable instead of taboo.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Hard limits on liminality prevent Ritual Time from becoming a permanent habitat.
author: Sean Devine

quote: When a rite is experienced as a Social Fact, you do not attend it; you submit to it.
author: Sean Devine

quote: If the ritual feels like a chore, you will get compliance; if it feels like a gift, you will get truth.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Beauty is not decoration; it is fuel for epimetabolic rate.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The non-violent alternative is to raise epimetabolic rate—heat the culture without burning it, and turn loss into structure on a deadline.
author: Sean Devine

quote: Renewal is not a restart; it is continuity through digestion.
author: Sean Devine

quote: If a ritual, metric, or role does not increase your epimetabolic rate, it is overhead and should be deprecated.
author: Sean Devine

quote: The program should be subject to the same rule it imposes: nothing is sacred except the commitment to metabolize error without sacrifice.
author: Sean Devine

quote: If your Ren is weak, I will not be contained by your Li.
author: Not Dionysus

quote: A ritual is a riverbank; if you make the water too hot, it may boil over the bank and drown the village.
author: Not Confucius

quote: If the ritual container cracks, you do not get renewal.
author: Not Apollo

quote: You are right that we advance by killing our theories so that we do not have to kill each other.
author: Not Karl Popper

quote: You call that tax "Ritual Time." I called it error-correcting code.
author: Not Claude Shannon

quote: Ritual Time is for jumping to the next one.
author: Not Andy Grove

quote: Sometimes, the only way to raise the epimetabolic rate is to induce a fever so high that it nearly kills the patient.
author: Not Carly Fiorina

quote: You argue that we must invite the heat inside the walls to avoid being burned by the fire outside.
author: Not Alfred Sloan

quote: A static society is one that employs rituals to prevent knowledge from growing, to keep the future exactly like the past.
author: Not David Deutsch

quote: You are trying to design a heat shield for organizations.
author: Not Abe Silverstein
